Description:
Overview**This position will be physically located in Qatar in support of LOGCAP**Assists and provides support in the administration of policies and procedures, employee in-processing, personnel maintenance, personnel reporting and data distribution. Provision of information to internal and external customers regarding Human Resource personnel actions with a high degree of discretion and confidentiality.ResponsibilitiesThis position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.Assist in the in-processing and out-processing of all employees
Enter and maintain employees in the company database system
Provide daily personnel accountability of both EXPAT and Foreign Nationals
Assist in daily Administrative and Personnel action activities to include the processing of updates to employee personal data in HR Database (i.e UKG, PayFactors, iCIMS)
Facilitate department wide personnel file audits and personnel file close out for terminated personnel for archiving and e-filing
Maintain leave request/leave control log as well as absence log
Maintain various spreadsheet trackers such as Requisitions for Vacancies and be able to coordinate positions needed to fill of both EXPAT and Foreign Nationals
Facilitate various ad hoc/demographic reporting through the current HR Database and the Projects HR System; vacation report, separation reports, termination reports
Assist in processing stipend payments, employee bonuses, annual offers, vacation travel allowance, and end of service gratuity
Accurately process Job Interest Form (JIF), Exception to Policy (ETP) and/or Personnel Transaction Forms (PTF) for new hires, promotions, transfers, intra-transfers, inter-transfers and terminations
Provide a high level of customer support to employees and project management, to include various requests for information from other programs and other audit/monitoring entities as required
Other duties as assignedQualificationsQualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Certifications: Bachelor's Degree in related field preferred, equivalent experience can be substituted for degree.
Education:
High school diploma or GED
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field preferred but not required
Experience:
Must have three (3) years of demonstrated Human Resource Administrative/Generalist experience.
Prefer large DoD Project/OCONUS HR Experience.
Skills:
Must have working knowledge of Qatar Labor Law, Middle East customs and work regulations.
Must have a high degree of professionalism, outstanding interpersonal skills, and excellent oral and written communication skills.
Must read, write, and speak English fluently.
Must be highly experienced in all MS Office Suite such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint and knowledge on how to manage Sharepoint Site.
MAJOR JOB ACTIVITIES:
Assist in the in-processing and out-processing of all employees.
Enter and maintain employees in the company database system.
Provide daily personnel accountability of both EXPAT and Foreign Nationals.
Assist in daily Administrative and Personnel action activities to include the processing of updates to employee personal data in HR Database (i.e UKG, PayFactors, iCIMS).
Facilitate department wide personnel file audits and personnel file close out for terminated personnel for archiving and e-filing.
Maintain leave request/leave control log as well as absence log.
Maintain various spreadsheet trackers such as Requisitions for Vacancies and be able to coordinate positions needed to fill of both EXPAT and Foreign Nationals.
Facilitate various ad hoc/demographic reporting through the current HR Database and the Projects HR System; vacation report, separation reports, termination reports.
Assist in processing stipend payments, employee bonuses, annual offers, vacation travel allowance, and end of service gratuity.
Accurately process Job Interest Form (JIF), Exception to Policy (ETP) and/or Personnel Transaction Forms (PTF) for new hires, promotions, transfers, intra-transfers, inter-transfers and terminations.
Provide a high level of customer support to employees and project management, to include various requests for information from other programs and other audit/monitoring entities as required.
Other duties as assigned.
WORKING ENVIRONMENT:
Works in a general office environment. However, duties will involve the conduct of work in the outdoors with a potential exposure to extreme climatic conditions including frequent dust storms, and high temperatures – up to 130 degrees in the summer months. Employee use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in certain areas is required. Such PPE includes but is not limited to head, foot, hand, torso, respiratory, vision and hearing protective devices. Will comply with all Fire, Safety and post policies. Normal work week is 48 hours, but must be able to work overtime or nights as required.
PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES:
Work may require heavy lifting up, stooping, climbing, prolonged standing, and prolonged sitting.We are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Vectrus is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability. EOE/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.Qualifications
